Record.Value: Mining + Fabrication
Explore the fundamentals of mining and fabrication.
Practical Training: Stage III

Welcome, Cadet. As a Stationeer deployed far from Earth, you have a choice: forge your own resources from local materials, or perish. Basic knowledge of mining and fabrication is essential. Repair the Lunar Test Base to prove your skills.
Practical Training: Stage III

Design often works backwards: to repair the testing base you need components, for which you need a hydraulic pipebender ... which you need resources to fabricate. So let's track down some ore using your tablet.
Get tablet from crate.
Practical Training: Stage III
The Xigo Padi tablet performs a range of different functions. With the tracking cartridge inserted, it helps you navigate to local beacons.
Add tracker cartridge from crate to tablet.
Turn tablet on.
Finding ore to build your base takes time. To help, we've placed a beacon at a nearby iron deposit. Use the tablet to navigate to the beacon, then get mining.
Navigate to the beacon

The tri-cone, rotary 'Topo' mining drill lives in your mining belt. Functioning equally well in vacuum and atmosphere, its cemented carbide bits increase resilience, bearing life, and reduce spalling. Treat it well.
Equip mining drill from mining belt in backpack.
Turn on drill
Mine 30 iron.
Your mining belt should now have plenty of iron ore in it. Carry it back to the base, and let's get smelting!
Return to the base
Before it can be used for construction, raw ore has to be turned into pure ingots. For that, the simplest solution is an arc furnace. Grab a kit from the crate and place it in the highlighted area.
Get an arc furnace kit from crate.
Place arc furnace in highlighted area.
Connect arc furnace to power using cables from toolbelt.
The arc furnace won't operate at high enough temperatures to create complex alloys, but it smelts iron just fine. Add your iron ore to the arc furnace.
Turn arc furnace on
Add iron ore to arc furnace
Activate arc furnace

Simple, fast and fairly efficient, an arc furnace also creates gas byproducts that can be filtered out and used for other purposes. Right now, however, you just need the ingots it makes - it's nearly finished.
Pick up ingot behind arc furnace
Add ingot to autolathe

The hydraulic pipebender makes pipes, as well as atmospheric devices and some portable structures. To build one with the autolathe you need iron, copper and gold. The other ingots you need are in the crate.
Pick up copper ingot from crate.
Add copper ingot to autolathe.
Pick up gold ingot from crate.
Add gold ingot to autolathe

The autolathe is multi-axis molecular compositional tool. It fabricates a range of structural and device kits, including the humble hydraulic pipebender. Click the search button on the front to search to select recipes.
Turn on autolathe.
Select hydraulic pipebender recipe using search function.
Print hydraulic pipebender kit.
Pick up hydraulic pipebender kit.
Place hydraulic pipebender in highlighted position.
Things take time: like the autolathe, the hydraulic pipebender has several construction stages. Follow the tooltips to finish constructing it.
Complete pipebender with resources from crate.
Turn on pipebender.
Versatility is a virtue. Need ingots in a hurry? Fabrication devices also provide resource storage. Eject them from the autolathe by pulling the lever, then add them to another machine.
Pull autolathe lever to eject ingots
Put iron ingot into pipebender
Put copper ingot into pipebender
Put gold ingot into pipebender
Active vents are critical airlock components: you can now fabricate one with the hydraulic pipebender!
Select active vent on pipebender.
Fabricate active vent using pipebender.
Turn off pipebender when fabrication is complete.
Pick up the active vent.
Good work, Cadet. You've created a complete fabrication system. That's the last step of Practical Testing, Phase III. Press the 'Complete' button to transmit your results to Stationeer Command.
Press transmit button to complete test.
Your mining belt does two things: It holds your mining tools, and stores the ore you mine. When it's equipped in your 'belt' slot, any ores mined are stored there automatically.
Equip mining belt.
That's it, you're done mining for now, so swap back to the tool belt - you'll be needing it shortly.
Equip tool belt.
